review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021
name: Bill
title: Best yoghurt ever
review: I used full fat milk, an instant pot with yoghurt setting - Greek style, with the bulk of whey drained out- mixed in some Marionberry jam - it’s truly the best I have ever had. Very tangy, will try 2% milk next- so much better than store bought

review: Unfortunately, my local market stopped carrying this. So very grateful to find such a great value here!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
name: Obsession
title: Dead cultures
review: OMG - so much money wasted using this. I purchased this a few months ago along with a yogurt machine. Followed all the instructions exactly as stated and ended up with just watery mix. I wasted gallons of milk thinking maybe the machine is bad or the temperature is not exactly right etc. nothing worked. I returned the yogurt maker. Of course this is non-refundable. It sat in my cabinet. I decided to try again and purchased another yogurt maker with great reviews. Tried again with one of these packets. Just watery mix. This time instead of returning the yogurt maker, I purchased full fat organic plain yogurt and tried it with the new yogurt maker last night(used 4 tbsp of yogurt to 1 quart of cow’s milk). Woke up today to perfect yogurt. So the culprit is this culture. Gallons of milk wasted. And I could have been eating awesome healthy homemade yogurt all this time if not for this.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2021
name: Brian
title: No good for me, dead cultures.
review: Three times I've tried to use this starter to make yogurt and three times it's turned out horrible. One time a complete watery mess and the other two not edible. I've used an actual fresh plain yogurt several times with great success so I can only assume that these cultures are dead or simply no good. I've followed the directions precisely and used my instant pot twice and stove top once with the same results. When using a live culture yogurt I've had no problems. Your results may vary.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
name: user
title: Waste of Money
review: I make yogurt very often; very successful. This is the first time I used this product and couple of times; failed. The final product was little thick compared to the regular yogurt. I wont recommend this product.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2020
name: parksee
title: Tastes just like plain greek yogurt!
review: I use the Suteck yogurt maker (bought on Amazon) which makes around 48 oz each time. I mix in one packet per 1 litre of warm milk as the instructions say. It takes 8 hours for the machine I use and a couple more hours chilling in the fridge. I start making them in the morning so that they're ready by evening. It stays firm and tastes just like plain greek yogurt sold in stores. I've used 10 packets so far and had 100% success rate so far!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
name: Subo
title: Great for the Gut
review: This works great for GF people with serious gut issues.Specific Carbohydrate Diet recommends this and it really is great.Replenishes good gut flora that is cooked out of regular store bought yogurt, made for mass consumption and held to safety standards.Making your own 24 hr yogurt is a game changer for IBS.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020

title: Salty final product.
review: Resulted very salty yogurt. I even added honey before I started, made it even saltier I wonder why.Good success rate though.
